names.english: tonify the kidneys and clear heat formula
names.commonEnglish: Tonify the Kidneys and Clear Heat Formula

actions: Clears Heat, cools the Blood and nourishes Yin.
With Bai Shao, for Blood Deficiency Heat.
Nourishes and tonifies Liver and Kidney Blood and Yin and benefits Jing.
With Mo Han Lian, for hemoptysis due to Yin Deficiency.
Tonifies the Spleen, nourishes Stomach Yin, tonifies Kidney Yin and astringes Jing.
Nourishes the Blood and regulates menstruation Astringes Yin.
Tonifies the Spleen, augments Qi, moderates and harmonizes the harsh properties of other herbs and guides the herbs to all twelve channels.
With Bai Shao, moderates spasms and alleviates pain, for painful spasms of the leg or abdomen.
Nourishes and tonifies Liver and Kidney Yin, cools the Blood and stops bleeding.
With Sheng Di Huang, for hematemesis and hematuria due to Hot Blood.
Drains Damp-Heat especially from the Lower Jiao.
Clears Heat, dries Dampness and promotes urination.
Tonifies the Spleen and Kidneys and astringes Jing.
Restrains, holds in and stops bleeding, secures Jing and stops discharge.
Cools the Blood, stops bleeding, invigorates the Blood and dispels Blood Stasis.
With Hai Piao Xiao, for excessive uterine bleeding.
Stops bleeding while reducing Blood Stasis.
Restrains and holds to stop bleeding and vaginal discharge, clears Heat, cools the Blood, binds the Intestines, stops bleeding and consolidates Jing.
Supplements the Kidneys
Nourishes Yin
Clears Heat
Eliminate Dampness
Stop bleeding
syndromes: Kidney Yin Deficiency with Damp Heat

symptoms: Aching, soreness or weakness of the low back
Aching in the leg and heel
Low grade fever in the afternoon
Dry throat, maybe recurrent sore throat
Yang jaundice (sclera and skin are bright yellow)
Maybe thirst or thirst with no desire to drink
Sweet sticky taste or bitter taste in mouth
manifestations.tongueCoat: Thick, yellow and greasy (maybe sticky) or Little or None
manifestations.pulse: Soft and rapid or Thready and rapid
